title: Understanding Fractions
transcript: Fractions represent equal parts of a whole. A fraction has two parts: the numerator and the denominator. The numerator shows how many parts we have, while the denominator shows how many equal parts the whole is divided into.

title: Adding Fractions
transcript: To add fractions with the same denominator, simply add the numerators and keep the denominator the same. For fractions with different denominators, first convert them to equivalent fractions with a common denominator.

title: Introduction to Algebra
transcript: Algebra is a branch of mathematics where letters are used to represent unknown numbers. An algebraic equation shows a relationship between known and unknown values. Example: x + 3 = 7.

title: Basic Geometry Shapes
transcript: Geometry deals with shapes and their properties. Common shapes include triangles, squares, rectangles, and circles. Each shape has unique characteristics such as sides, angles, and symmetry.

title: Simple Interest Formula
transcript: Simple interest is calculated using the formula SI = (P × R × T) / 100, where P is principal amount, R is rate of interest, and T is time in years.

title: Photosynthesis
transcript: Photosynthesis is the process by which green plants use sunlight to convert carbon dioxide and water into glucose and oxygen. Chlorophyll in the leaves helps absorb sunlight.

title: Plant Cells
transcript: A plant cell contains a cell wall, cell membrane, nucleus, chloroplasts, and vacuoles. Chloroplasts help plants make food through photosynthesis.

title: Water Cycle
transcript: The water cycle includes evaporation, condensation, and precipitation. Water from oceans evaporates, forms clouds, and falls as rain or snow.

title: States of Matter
transcript: Matter exists in three states: solid, liquid, and gas. Solids have fixed shape, liquids take the shape of their container, and gases spread out to fill the available space.

title: Renewable Energy
transcript: Renewable energy comes from natural sources like sunlight, wind, and water. These sources replenish naturally and are better for the environment.

title: Fractions in Hindi
transcript: भिन्न संख्याएँ किसी वस्तु के बराबर भागों को दर्शाती हैं। भिन्न के दो भाग होते हैं - अंश और हर। अंश बताता है कि हमारे पास कितने भाग हैं और हर बताता है कि कुल कितने बराबर भाग हैं।

title: गुणा और भाग (Multiplication and Division)
transcript: गुणा बार-बार जोड़ने का संक्षिप्त रूप है। उदाहरण: 3 × 4 का अर्थ है 3 को चार बार जोड़ना। भाग एक संख्या को बराबर हिस्सों में बाँटने की प्रक्रिया है।

title: बीजगणित परिचय (Algebra Basics)
transcript: बीजगणित में हम संख्याओं के स्थान पर अक्षरों का उपयोग करते हैं। समीकरण में ज्ञात और अज्ञात राशियाँ होती हैं। उदाहरण: x + 5 = 12।

title: पौधों में प्रकाश संश्लेषण
transcript: प्रकाश संश्लेषण वह प्रक्रिया है जिसमें पौधे सूर्य के प्रकाश की सहायता से कार्बन डाइऑक्साइड और पानी से भोजन बनाते हैं। इस प्रक्रिया में ग्लूकोज और ऑक्सीजन उत्पन्न होते हैं।

title: भारतीय मौसम चक्र
transcript: भारत में मौसम चक्र में गर्मी, वर्षा और सर्दी के प्रमुख मौसम शामिल हैं। मानसून जून से सितंबर तक वर्षा लाता है।

title: English Grammar: Nouns
transcript: A noun is a word that names a person, place, thing, or idea. Examples include teacher, city, apple, and happiness.

title: English Grammar: Verbs
transcript: A verb is an action word. It describes what someone or something does. Examples: run, eat, play, think.

title: History: Indus Valley Civilization
transcript: The Indus Valley Civilization was one of the earliest urban civilizations. It had planned cities, drainage systems, and advanced architecture.

title: Civics: What is Democracy?
transcript: Democracy is a form of government where people elect their representatives. It ensures equality, freedom, and participation.

title: Geography: Types of Landforms
transcript: Landforms are natural features on Earth. Common landforms include mountains, plateaus, plains, deserts, and valleys.
